newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat, Generali detail Prime sale.
newsitem.headline: Fiat, Generali detail Prime sale.

text.p: Italian insurer Generali will acquire outright control of Prime following a deal to acquire the Fiat group's 95.1 percent stake in the Italian fund manager, Fiat and Generali said in a joint statement on Tuesday.
The statement said Generali would also acquire a stake in life insurance venture Prime Augusta Vita from Fiat, raising Generali's shareholding in Prime Augusta to 40 percent.
Industrial sources said earlier that Generali was acquiring an 18 percent stake in Prime Augusta from the Fiat group.
The statement said the value of the deal between the Fiat group and Generali was 325 billion lire.
It added that Generali would buy Sumitomo Life's residual five percent stake in Prime.
Other shareholders in Prime Augusta include Augusta Assicurazioni, controlled by Fiat, Credito Agrario Bresciano. The statement said Generali would take over the management of Prime Augusta.
The deal was subject to approval by the boards of the companies involved.
